Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.Electricity can be produced from a variety of fuels and methods.(a) Although producing electricity from burning fossil fuels, such as in coal-fired power plants, is common around the world, some scientists and economists argue that where the geography is appropriate, hydroelectric power is a better method for generating electricity.(i) Describe one advantage of using hydroelectric power plants over using coal-fired power plants.(ii) Describe one potential disadvantage of hydroelectric power plants.

frqParts.text: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.Electricity can be produced from a variety of fuels and methods.(a) Although producing electricity from burning fossil fuels, such as in coal-fired power plants, is common around the world, some scientists and economists argue that where the geography is appropriate, hydroelectric power is a better method for generating electricity.(i) Describe one advantage of using hydroelectric power plants over using coal-fired power plants.(ii) Describe one potential disadvantage of hydroelectric power plants.

(b) In some areas, hydroelectric power is not geographically appropriate and a different renewable energy source would be a better option. A conservation group is looking for renewable energy sources other than hydroelectric energy that could be used to generate electricity in grassland ecosystems, such as in the midwestern United States or in a savanna in Africa.(i) Propose a different renewable resource to use that would be a realistic solution to generating electricity without using fossil fuels or hydroelectric power in a grassland ecosystem.(ii) Justify the solution proposed in (b)(i) by explaining a potential advantage of using a different renewable resource to generate electricity.

The information in the table below gives information about energy use in a typical house. A typical house in the United States uses about <math alttext="10,900 k W h"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10</mtext><mtext>,900</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (kilowatt-hour) of electricity per year. <math alttext="1 T W h"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>TWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (terawatt-hour) <math alttext="equals 1 times 10 raised to the 6 power, G W h"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>=</mtext> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>1</mtext> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>GWh</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> (gigawatt-hour) <math alttext="equals 1 times 10 raised to the 9 power, k W h"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>k</mtext><mtext>Wh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (kilowatt-hour). (c) One recent cost analysis report indicates that electricity from hydroelectric power can be produced for about <math alttext="$0.05"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per <math alttext="kWh"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> , while electricity from conventional coal-fired power plants can be produced for an average of about <math alttext="$0.11"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>0.11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per <math alttext="kWh"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> . Calculate the percent change in the cost of electricity for a typical house resulting from a switch between conventional coal-fired power plants to hydroelectric power. Show your work.

(d) In a typical coal-fired power plant, <math alttext="2,460 kilowatt hours"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>460</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of electricity can be produced per ton of coal burned. Calculate how many tons of coal would have to be burned in a typical coal-fired power plant to provide the electricity for a typical house in the United States for a year. Show your work.

(e) The world’s largest hydroelectric power plant is the <math alttext="22.5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>22.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gigawatt (<math alttext="G W"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Three Gorges Dam in China. It produces about <math alttext="90 terawatt hours"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>TWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of electricity each year. If a hydroelectric plant with the same capacity as the Three Gorges Dam was built in the United States, calculate how many houses such a plant would be able to provide the electricity for in a year. Show your work.
